    def polynom_pd(self):  # Polynomrechnung des Palladiumstreifens

        ###################################################

        e_cutoff = self.value_slider.value()  # in keV

        # Be_thickness = self.box_param5.value()                  # in µm

        # Al_thickness = self.box_param2.value()                  # in µm
        filter1_thickness = self.box_param2.value()  # in µm

        # Cu_thickness = self.box_param4.value()                  # in µm
        filter2_thickness = self.box_param4.value()  # in µm

        # W_thickness = 0            # in µm; only for testing of potential new filters

        ###################################################

        e = e_cutoff

        polynom = 0.94741 - 0.09397 * e + 0.00479 * e ** 2 - 1.38944e-4 * e ** 3 + 2.39143e-6 * e ** 4 - \
            2.41185e-8 * e ** 5 + 1.31582e-10 * e ** 6 - 2.99604e-13 * e ** 7

        theta_grad = polynom

        theta_rad = theta_grad * math.pi / 180

        # print('Cutoff Energy =', E, 'keV')

        # print('theta =', theta_grad, 'Grad')

        # print('Beam height at experiment =', 10*theta_grad, 'mm')

        self.text_calculations.setText('theta= %s\nBeam height at experiment = %s' %
                                       (str(round(theta_grad, 5)), str(round(10 * theta_grad, 2))))

        # WLS 7T Spectrum: 7 T WLS bei BESSY II: W = 1700 MeV, B = 7 T; I = 200 mA, d = 20 m;

        # Pd_list[[Energy in keV],[delta],[beta]]

        pd_list = [
            [9.2, 9.4, 9.6, 9.8, 10, 10.2, 10.4, 10.6, 10.8, 11, 11.2, 11.4, 11.6, 11.8, 12, 12.2, 12.4, 12.6, 12.8, 13,
             13.2, 13.4, 13.6, 13.8, 14, 14.2, 14.4, 14.6, 14.8, 15, 15.2, 15.4, 15.6, 15.8, 16, 16.2, 16.4, 16.6, 16.8,
             17, 17.2, 17.4, 17.6, 17.8, 18, 18.2, 18.4, 18.6, 18.8, 19, 19.2, 19.4, 19.6, 19.8, 20, 20.2, 20.4, 20.6,
             20.8, 21, 21.2, 21.4, 21.6, 21.8, 22, 22.2, 22.4, 22.6, 22.8, 23, 23.2, 23.4, 23.6, 23.8, 24, 24.2, 24.4,
             24.6, 24.8, 25, 25.2, 25.4, 25.6, 25.8, 26, 26.2, 26.4, 26.6, 26.8, 27, 27.2, 27.4, 27.6, 27.8, 28, 28.2,
             28.4, 28.6, 28.8, 29, 29.2, 29.4, 29.6, 29.8, 30, 30.2, 30.4, 30.6, 30.8, 31, 31.2, 31.4, 31.6, 31.8, 32,
             32.2, 32.4, 32.6, 32.8, 33, 33.2, 33.4, 33.6, 33.8, 34, 34.2, 34.4, 34.6, 34.8, 35, 35.2, 35.4, 35.6, 35.8,
             36, 36.2, 36.4, 36.6, 36.8, 37, 37.2, 37.4, 37.6, 37.8, 38, 38.2, 38.4, 38.6, 38.8, 39, 39.2, 39.4, 39.6,
             39.8, 40, 40.2, 40.4, 40.6, 40.8, 41, 41.2, 41.4, 41.6, 41.8, 42, 42.2, 42.4, 42.6, 42.8, 43, 43.2, 43.4,
             43.6, 43.8, 44, 44.2, 44.4, 44.6, 44.8, 45, 45.2, 45.4, 45.6, 45.8, 46, 46.2, 46.4, 46.6, 46.8, 47, 47.2,
             47.4, 47.6, 47.8, 48, 48.2, 48.4, 48.6, 48.8, 49, 49.2, 49.4, 49.6, 49.8, 50, 50.2, 50.4, 50.6, 50.8, 51,

             55, 55.2, 55.4, 55.6, 55.8, 56, 56.2, 56.4, 56.6, 56.8, 57, 57.2, 57.4, 57.6, 57.8, 58, 58.2, 58.4, 58.6,

             43.6, 43.8, 44, 44.2, 44.4, 44.6, 44.8, 45, 45.2, 45.4, 45.6, 45.8, 46, 46.2, 46.4, 46.6, 46.8, 47, 47.2,

        # W_list[[Energy in keV],[mu(1/µm)]]

        w_list = [
            [9.2, 9.4, 9.6, 9.8, 10, 10.2, 10.4, 10.6, 10.8, 11, 11.2, 11.4, 11.6, 11.8, 12, 12.2, 12.4, 12.6, 12.8, 13,
             13.2, 13.4, 13.6, 13.8, 14, 14.2, 14.4, 14.6, 14.8, 15, 15.2, 15.4, 15.6, 15.8, 16, 16.2, 16.4, 16.6, 16.8,
             17, 17.2, 17.4, 17.6, 17.8, 18, 18.2, 18.4, 18.6, 18.8, 19, 19.2, 19.4, 19.6, 19.8, 20, 20.2, 20.4, 20.6,

            [0.23324, 0.22084, 0.20931, 0.19863, 0.18877, 0.17971, 0.42617, 0.40422, 0.38378, 0.36473, 0.34693, 0.33029,

             0.03354, 0.03301, 0.03249, 0.03199, 0.0315, 0.03101, 0.03054, 0.03008, 0.02962, 0.02918, 0.02874, 0.02832,

             0.02, 0.01975, 0.01949, 0.01924, 0.019, 0.01876, 0.01852, 0.01829, 0.01806, 0.01784, 0.01762, 0.0174,
             0.01719, 0.01698, 0.01678, 0.01658, 0.01638, 0.01618, 0.01599, 0.0158, 0.01561, 0.01543, 0.01525, 0.01507,

             0.01301, 0.01286, 0.01272, 0.01259, 0.01245, 0.01232, 0.01219, 0.01206, 0.01193, 0.0118, 0.01168, 0.01156,
             0.01144, 0.01132, 0.0112, 0.01109, 0.01097, 0.01086, 0.01075, 0.01064, 0.01054, 0.01043, 0.01033, 0.01022,
             0.01012, 0.01002, 0.00992, 0.00983, 0.00973, 0.00964, 0.00954, 0.00945, 0.00936, 0.00927, 0.00918, 0.0091,
             0.00901, 0.00893, 0.00884, 0.00876, 0.00868, 0.0086, 0.00852, 0.00844, 0.00836, 0.00829, 0.00821, 0.00814,
             0.00806, 0.00799, 0.00792, 0.00785, 0.00778, 0.00771, 0.00764, 0.00757, 0.00751, 0.00744, 0.00738, 0.00731,
             0.00725, 0.00719, 0.00713, 0.00707, 0.00701, 0.00695, 0.00689, 0.00683, 0.00677, 0.00672, 0.00666, 0.00661,
             0.00655, 0.0065, 0.00644, 0.00639, 0.00634, 0.00629, 0.00624, 0.00619, 0.00614, 0.00609, 0.00604, 0.00599,
             0.00594, 0.0059, 0.00585, 0.0058, 0.00576, 0.00571, 0.00567, 0.00563, 0.00558, 0.00554, 0.0055, 0.00546,
             0.00541, 0.00537, 0.00533, 0.00529, 0.00525, 0.00521, 0.00517, 0.00514, 0.0051, 0.00506, 0.00502, 0.00499,
             0.00495, 0.00491, 0.00488, 0.02124, 0.02113, 0.02099, 0.02084, 0.0207, 0.02055, 0.02041, 0.02027, 0.02014,
             0.02, 0.01987, 0.01973, 0.0196, 0.01946, 0.01932, 0.01919, 0.01905, 0.01891, 0.01877, 0.01863, 0.0185,
             0.01838, 0.01825, 0.01813, 0.01801, 0.01789, 0.01778, 0.01766, 0.01755, 0.01743, 0.01732, 0.01721, 0.0171,
             0.01699, 0.01688, 0.01677, 0.01666, 0.01655, 0.01645, 0.01634, 0.01623, 0.01612, 0.01602, 0.01591, 0.01581,
             0.01571, 0.0156, 0.0155, 0.0154, 0.0153, 0.0152]]

        spektrum = [None] * len(pd_list[0])

        # welche Filter sind ausgewählt?

        filter1_text = self.box_param1.currentText()
        filter2_text = self.box_param3.currentText()
        filter1_list = be_list
        filter2_list = be_list

        if 'Al' in filter1_text:
            filter1_list = al_list
        elif 'Be' in filter1_text:
            filter1_list = be_list
        elif 'Cu' in filter1_text:
            filter1_list = cu_list
        elif 'W' in filter1_text:
            filter1_list = w_list
        elif 'none' in filter1_text:
            filter1_list = [[0] * len(pd_list[0]), [0] * len(pd_list[0])]

        if 'Al' in filter2_text:
            filter2_list = al_list
        elif 'Be' in filter2_text:
            filter2_list = be_list
        elif 'Cu' in filter2_text:
            filter2_list = cu_list
        elif 'W' in filter2_text:
            filter2_list = w_list
        elif 'none' in filter2_text:
            filter2_list = [[0] * len(pd_list[0]), [0] * len(pd_list[0])]

        i = 0

        while i < len(pd_list[0]):
            # Reflection

            pd_delta = pd_list[1][i]

            pd_beta = pd_list[2][i]

            komplex = complex(1 - pd_delta, pd_beta)

            k_iz = math.sin(theta_rad)

            k_tz = (komplex ** 2 - (math.cos(theta_rad)) ** 2) ** 0.5

            r = (k_iz - k_tz) / (k_iz + k_tz)

            reflection = (abs(r)) ** 2

            # Transmission

            # mu_Be = be_list[1][i]
            #
            # mu_Al = al_list[1][i]
            #
            # mu_Cu = cu_list[1][i]
            #
            # mu_W = w_list[1][i]
            #
            # transmission_Be = math.exp(-mu_Be * Be_thickness)
            #
            # transmission_Al = math.exp(-mu_Al * Al_thickness)
            #
            # transmission_Cu = math.exp(-mu_Cu * Cu_thickness)
            #
            # transmission_W = math.exp(-mu_W * W_thickness)
            #
            # spektrum[i] = (reflection * transmission_Be * transmission_Al * transmission_Cu * transmission_W)

            mu_filter1 = filter1_list[1][i]
            mu_filter2 = filter2_list[1][i]

            transmission_filter1 = math.exp(-mu_filter1 * filter1_thickness)
            transmission_filter2 = math.exp(-mu_filter2 * filter2_thickness)

            spektrum[i] = (reflection * transmission_filter1 * transmission_filter2)

            i = i + 1

        x_data = pd_list[0]
        y_data = spektrum

        self.Graph.plot(x_data, y_data, pen='k', clear=True, name='reflectivity')
